content-model-datamap: The name for Interactive Data Map content model, used when describing what type of content a page contains.
datamap-doc-page-does-not-exist:
Message displayed if the documentation page does not exist.

Parameters:
* $1 - the prefixed title of the doc page
datamap-doc-page-header:
Message displayed at the top of the documentation page. Parameters:
* $1 - the prefixed title of the module
datamap-category-pages-including-maps:
{{tracking category name}}
Name of the tracking category for pages including maps.
datamap-category-pages-including-broken-:
{{tracking category name}}
Name of the tracking category for pages including maps failing validation.
datamap-category-maps-failing-validation:
{{tracking category name}}
Name of the tracking category for maps failing validation.
datamap-mapsrcinfo-internal-page:
{{Doc-screenshot|DataMaps Source code page notice no errors.png}}
Message shown in a box above the map, only on source code pages (that is, not in articles). It informs the editor that readers should view maps embedded in articles, rather than using the source code page.

Alternative wording if English one is too awkward:
* "You're currently on the source code page of this map. [...]"
* or "This page is the source page of a map. [...]"
datamap-mapsrcinfo-status-ok:
{{Doc-screenshot|DataMaps Source code page notice no errors.png}}
Message shown in a box above the map, only on source code pages (that is, not in articles). It indicates no problems with the map's source code (it passes data validation).
datamap-mapsrcinfo-status-meh:
Message shown in a box above the map, only on source code pages (that is, not in articles). It indicates minor problems (warnings from data validation) with the map's source code - such as using a deprecated schema revision, or fields that won't be supported in future.

This message is immediately followed by message {{msg-mw|datamap-mapsrcinfo-heading-warnings}} on the next line, with a list of the errors.
datamap-mapsrcinfo-heading-errors:
{{Doc-screenshot|DataMaps Source code page notice with errors.png}}
Message used to display the error list on validation errors instead of the map, only on source code pages. It is always accompanied by {{msg-mw|datamap-mapsrcinfo-status-errors}}.

Parameters:
* $1 - the error bulletpoint list.
datamap-mapsrcinfo-heading-warnings:
Message used to display the warning list on validation issues above the map, only on source code pages. It is always accompanied by {{msg-mw|datamap-mapsrcinfo-status-meh}}, and sometimes by {{msg-mw|datamap-mapsrcinfo-status-errors}}.

Parameters:
* $1 - the warning bulletpoint list.
datamap-mapsrcinfo-docslink:
Message shown after validation errors and warnings. It informs the user of the extension's documentation pages and issue tracker.

Parameters:
* $1 - non-localisable documentation link.
* $2 - non-localisable issue tracker link.
datamap-error-validate-invalid-json: Error message shown on general JSON syntax errors.
datamap-validate-bad-schema: {{doc-important|Do not translate $schema}} Error shown if the map's source code has no $schema field or it is not a link (URL), a path, or the revision it points at is not supported by the software. Parameters: * $1 - list of supported $schema values. Example item: /extensions/DataMaps/schemas/v17.json.
datamap-validate-constraint-required:
Error message shown when a property is expected (required per schema) in the map's source code, but is missing.

Parameters:
* $1 - non-localised path to the missing property.
datamap-validate-constraint-type:
An error message shown when data validation fails due to a malformed property (for example a string value for a numeric property).

Parameters:
* $1 - property path.
datamap-validate-constraint-unexpected:
Error message shown when a property is set but disallowed (not needed per the schema) in the map's source code, but is missing.

Parameters:
* $1 - non-localised path to the missing property.
datamap-validate-constraint-regex:
An error message shown when data validation fails due to a malformed string value (not matching an internal regular expression).

Parameters:
* $1 - property path.
datamap-validate-constraint-empty:
An error message shown when data validation fails due to an empty string value, where a non-empty string value was expected.

Parameters:
* $1 - property path.
datamap-validate-constraint-minlength:
An error message shown when data validation fails due to a string value that's shorter than expected.

Parameters:
* $1 - property path.
* $2 - expected minimum number of characters, in digits.
datamap-validate-constraint-minimum:
An error message shown when data validation fails due to a numeric value that's lower than expected.

Parameters:
* $1 - property path.
* $2 - expected minimum value, in digits.
datamap-validate-constraint-maximum:
An error message shown when data validation fails due to a numeric value that's higher than expected.

Parameters:
* $1 - property path.
* $2 - expected maximum value, in digits.
datamap-validate-constraint-fallback:
A generic error message shown when data validation fails, but no message exists for the issue.

Parameters:
* $1 - property path.
* $2 - link to the extension's bug tracker
datamap-validate-constraint-notcollectib:
A warning message shown when a property, valid only for collectibles, is set on a non-collectible marker group. This is not critical.

Parameters:
* $1 - property path of the group.
* $2 - list of invalid properties, comma-delimited.
datamap-validate-constraint-searchdisabl:
A warning message shown when a search-configuring property is found in a map with disabled marker search. This is not critical.

Parameters:
* $1 - property path of the group/marker.
* $2 - list of invalid properties, comma-delimited.
datamap-validate-constraint-requiredfile:
An error message shown when data validation fails due to missing files.

Parameters:
* $1 - a human-readable list of missing files, preformatted, delimited by commas.
datamap-validate-constraint-muidoverlap:
An error message shown when data validation fails due to two or more markers sporting the same unique linking identifiers.

Parameters:
* $1 - property path of the second (later) marker of the pair.
* $2 - the identifier.
datamap-validate-constraint-groupexists:
Error message shown when markers are attached to a marker group, whose data is missing.

Parameters:
* $1 - list of marker-to-layer associations, user-supplied (in the map's source code).
* $2 - missing group's name, non-localisable.
datamap-validate-constraint-bglayerexist:
Error message shown when background-specific markers have been added, but the referenced background has not been defined.

Parameters:
* $1 - list of marker-to-layer associations, user-supplied (in the map's source code).
* $2 - name of the background's marker layer, non-localisable.
datamap-validate-constraint-layerdeclove:
Error message shown when a marker group and a marker category have been defined under the same identifier.

Parameters:
* $1 - property path to the group.
* $2 - property path to the category.
datamap-validate-constraint-assocgroupov:
Error message shown when the user attempted to add markers to multiple marker groups at the same time (only one group is allowed per a set of markers).

Parameters:
* $1 - property path to the marker set.
* $2 - comma-delimited, preformatted list of all groups the marker set is being associated to.
datamap-validate-constraint-assocnonuniq:
Error message shown when markers are being added to the same marker group or category more than once.

Parameters:
* $1 - property path to the marker set.
datamap-validate-constraint-deprecated-i:
Warning message shown when a deprecated property (denoted by $3) is used, and an alternative is available.

Parameters:
* $1 - schema revision that the property was marked as depreciated in.
* $2 - schema revision that the property was marked as depreciated in.
* $3 - property path.
* $4 - replacement property path.
datamap-validate-constraint-deprecated-n:
Warning message shown when a deprecated property (denoted by $3) is used, and an alternative is '''not''' available.

Parameters:
* $1 - schema revision that the property was marked as depreciated in.
* $2 - schema revision that the property was marked as depreciated in.
* $3 - property path.
datamap-validate-constraint-zoomminmax:
Error message shown during editing when the user-specified maximum zoom level is a lower value than the minimum level.

Parameters:
* $1 - maximum zoom level property path.
* $2 - minimum zoom level property path.
datamap-error-validatespec-map-bad-mixin:
{{doc-important|The content model name should match {{msg-mw|content-model-datamap}}}}
Error message when a reusable source fragment page does not exist, has an incorrect content model or fails validation.

Parameters:
* $1 - page name of the referenced fragment.
datamap-error-validatespec-map-mixin-wit: Error message shown when a reusable source fragment contains a include field to include other fragments.
datamap-error-render-unsupported-display:
Error shown when the programmer messed up in the extension's code. 'Display mode' refers to a marker's visual style (circular, icon, pin), but the server-side code does not know how to handle it.

Parameters:
* $1 - internal numeric ID of a marker visual style.
datamap-error-pf-page-does-not-exist:
Error shown instead of a map when the map's source page does not exist.

Parameters:
* $1 - page name of the map.
datamap-error-pf-page-invalid-content-mo: {{doc-important|The content model name should match {{msg-mw|content-model-datamap}}}} Error shown instead of a map when the map's source page is not of the Interactive Data Map content model. Parameters: * $1 - page name of the map.
datamap-error-pf-max-width-invalid: Error shown instead of a map when the max-width parameter (provided by an editor to the DataMap/Map function) is equal to or lower than zero.
datamap-error-map-validation-fail: Error message shown instead of the map if the source code no longer passes data validation without errors (likely due to the extension getting updated).
datamap-background-name-fallback: Fallback display name for backgrounds, used if the name property is not set. This is shown to regular users primarily in the background selection dropdown.
datamap-legend-label: Button label for opening the legend panel (including filtering buttons, collectibles list) of the map.
datamap-javascript-required: Message shown instead of the map if the reader has JavaScript support disabled in their browser.
datamap-loading-js: Message temporarily shown instead of a map while the extension's scripts are being loaded.
datamap-loading-data: Message temporarily shown instead of a map while the map's data is being loaded.
datamap-error-dataload: Error shown over a map if the map's data failed to load. The reason for the failure is unknown (but likely occurred due to a server-side or network error).
datamap-lazy-click-to-load: Label of the button used to load a data map a request, if the map is set not to load on page view.
datamap-legend-tab-locations: Label of the legend (Contents) tab containing toggles for marker visibility.
datamap-toggle-show-all:
Label of the button used to set all marker groups to be shown, in a single click. It is located above marker group visibility toggles.
{{Identical|Show all}}
datamap-toggle-hide-all: Label of the button used to set all marker groups to not be shown, in a single click. It is located above marker group visibility toggles.
datamap-layer-control:
Label of the dropdown button, which lists visibility toggles for marker categories. It is located above marker group visibility toggles, only if there are any markers that would be affected by toggles within.

At the moment, this dropdown only lists the ''Caves'' and ''Surface'' toggles.
datamap-legend-tab-checklist: Label of the legend (Contents) tab containing all lists of available collectibles on the map.
datamap-checklist-prelude: Message shown at the top of the 'Checklists' tab. It refers to collectible markers, which the user can dismiss to hide.
datamap-interact-touch: Message shown over the map on mobile devices when the viewer attempts to reposition the viewport with a single finger. This requirement exists to avoid interfering with page scrolling.
datamap-interact-scroll: Message shown over the map on desktop devices when the viewer attempts to reposition the viewport with a simple mouse drag. This requirement exists to avoid interfering with page scrolling. CTRL and Scroll refer to the Control key on keyboard and mouse scrolling respectively.
datamap-interact-scroll-mac: Message shown over the map on desktop devices when the viewer attempts to reposition the viewport with a simple mouse drag. This requirement exists to avoid interfering with page scrolling. ⌘ and Scroll refer to the ⌘ key on Mac keyboards and mouse scrolling respectively.
datamap-layer-surface:
Label of the toggle checkbox that controls visibility of markers located on surface (not in caves). It is located in the "Toggle" dropdown above marker group visibility toggles, next to the "Show all" and "Hide all" buttons.

This is a part of the old category model (which was specific to the ARK Wiki) and will be removed in future with a dynamic/runtime system.
datamap-layer-cave:
Label of the toggle checkbox that controls visibility of markers located inside caves. It is located in the "Toggle" dropdown above marker group visibility toggles, next to the "Show all" and "Hide all" buttons.

This is a part of the old category model (which was specific to the ARK Wiki) and will be removed in future with a dynamic/runtime system.
datamap-popup-related-article:
Link label for the 'Read more' button (that leads to an article) at the bottom of a marker's detail popup.
{{Identical|Read more}}
datamap-popup-dismissed: Label for the 'Collected' button at the bottom of a marker's detail popup. It denotes the marker has already been dismissed/hidden, and that state can be reverted by clicking this button.
datamap-popup-mark-as-dismissed: Label for the 'Mark as collected' button (that hides the marker) at the bottom of a marker's detail popup. It denotes the marker can be dismissed/hidden.
datamap-popup-marker-link-get: Text letting users know that they can copy a sharable link to a marker on the map. Displayed at the bottom of a marker's details popup.
datamap-popup-marker-link-copied: Message shown when a marker link is successfully copied to the viewer's clipboard.
datamap-coordinate-control-text:
On maps configured to use a coordinate scheme of 'Latitude then Longitude', message shown in the bottom-left corner of the map containing current mouse cursor coordinates, if the mouse cursor is currently over the map.

Parameters:
* $1 - latitude.
* $2 - longitude.

Maps using other schemes will use one of following messages instead:
* datamap-coordinate-control-text-xy
* datamap-coordinate-control-text-yx
datamap-coordinate-control-text-xy:
{{optional}}
On maps configured to use a coordinate scheme of 'X then Y', message shown in the bottom-left corner of the map containing current mouse cursor coordinates, if the mouse cursor is currently over the map.

Parameters:
* $1 - Y coordinate.
* $2 - X coordinate.

Maps using other schemes will use one of following messages instead:
* datamap-coordinate-control-text
* datamap-coordinate-control-text-yx
datamap-coordinate-control-text-yx:
{{optional}}
On maps configured to use a coordinate scheme of 'Y then X', message shown in the bottom-left corner of the map containing current mouse cursor coordinates, if the mouse cursor is currently over the map.

Parameters:
* $1 - Y coordinate.
* $2 - X coordinate.

Maps using other schemes will use one of following messages instead:
* datamap-coordinate-control-text
* datamap-coordinate-control-text-xy
datamap-control-zoom-in:
Title for map zoom in button.
{{Identical|Zoom in}}
datamap-control-zoom-out:
Title for map zoom out button.
{{Identical|Zoom out}}
datamap-control-reset-view: Title for map button restoring default viewport location and zoom.
datamap-control-centre-view: Title for map button placing the viewport at the centre of the map.
datamap-control-edit: Label of the button that opens the map's source page in an editor. Shown only to logged-in users.
datamap-control-search: Text message shown in the map's marker search text field when empty, prompting the viewer to input a query.
datamap-control-search-toggle-sharing:
Label for a toggle situated in the marker search text input. The toggle controls whether results from other map tabs within a tabber will be shown within this map's search results.

Alternatively "All tabs". Please keep this message short if possible.
datamap-control-search-no-results: Text message that no markers were found. Shown in the map's built-in search panel.
datamap-control-fullscreen: Tooltip for the button that switches the map into (and out of) full screen mode.
